messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Sandra Dodd radio interview
messages.msgSnippet: On Mar 23, 2005, at 6:43 PM, Penn Acres wrote: -=-I can get the site but cant see how to hear the program.... Help?-=- Go to
messages.messageBody:
On Mar 23, 2005, at 6:43 PM, Penn Acres wrote:

-=-I can get the site but cant see how to hear the program.... Help?-=-

Go to http://www.radio4all.net/proginfo.php?id=11724 then scroll ALL
the way down to the bottom of the page. There's a small "table" there.
The column all the way to the right is labeled "Download". Click on
the link under it that just says: http
ftp (both are lines are underscored like a link)

This should automatically take you to a page that is blank other than a
small box with play/stop/etc and the interview should automatically
start playing. Be sure to have your sound/speakers on. The music and
intros are kind of loud, but you need to turn it up to hear Sandra
speaking.

Hope that helps!

-Tracy-

"Every moment spent in unhappiness is a moment of
happiness lost." -- Leo Buscaglia

messages.subject: Sandra Dodd radio interview
messages.msgSnippet: Sandra Dodd, was recently interviewed on the radio and you can listen to it online.  Go to the link below and then scroll down to the bottom of the page and
messages.messageBody:
Sandra Dodd, was recently interviewed on the radio and you can listen
to it online. Go to the link below and then scroll down to the bottom
of the page and click on the link on the right that says:

http
ftp

Enjoy!
-Tracy-


Begin forwarded message:

http://www.radio4all.net/proginfo.php?id=11724
 
I was interviewed for a radio show by unschoolers in Hamilton, in
Ontario, "Radio Free School."  I was
asked to discuss strewing and spirituality, so those are the themes.  I
used a couple of examples I've
used in other talks, but also said some things I'd never said before,
so I'm happy with it.  It's edited down
pretty tightly (half an hour from a 90 minute interview), so it sounds
like I talk even faster than I really
DO talk.  (Also I said "civil war" when I had intended to say something
else, but so it goes... overall I
think it's good.)  There are musical interludes. <g>  Either I forgot
to say or it was cut that the kids were
offered their jobs, and didn't apply for them.  (So it's partly that
they were noticeably cool kids that got
them the offer, I suppose, and I wish I'd said that.)

Sandra Dodd

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
